p:
Despite shortcomings of coarse climate models and simple delta downscaling, the comparison with high-resolution GFDL CM2.6 supports the accuracy of our methods here. The two models were within 12% of one another throughout the shelf; however, GFDL CM2.6 showed a more nuanced projection (Fig.Â 7). GFDL CM2.6 showed a larger decrease on the Shelf Break and the Northeast Channel where a northern shift in the Gulf Stream is unaccounted for in the ensemble of coarse climate models
17 . The ensemble projected greater losses in the Bay of Fundy, Southern New England, and around Cape Cod, likely due to the shallow bathymetry in these regions that were still not resolved in the downscaling.
